  • 2005-09-13 08:37:00

    Confirmed

    I have confirmed the problem, but I can not tell you why it is happening.

    I can not reproduce the problem on any other system, so I might guess that the changes you have made to ATutor are interfering with test functionality. Restore your system back to the original and see if that helps: removing the flash header, and removing the contents listed at the top of each page. Or, install a fresh version of ATutor and see if the problem continues.

    There are other issues with your system. I am unable to investigate because the support system info screen we use to troubleshoot can not be opened include/info.php. It is a phpinfo page.

  • 2005-09-22 11:06:00

    No luck with a solution

    The anonymous "solution" is actually a test to see if it is the MySQL CAST() function as Joel described, is the problem. Apparently that's not the problem in your case.

    Joel, Heidi and myself have all spent many hours each trying to reproduce the problem on a variety of different systems, without any luck. Tests work fine on all our systems.

    All I can suggest is that you move off the Winxp server you are using and use a Linux/Unix system. Window XP as a server leaves much to be desired. Problems such as those described here are almost inevitable reported by Windows users. That said though, we've tried to reproduce the problem ourselves on Winxp pro & home, and Win 2000. Everything works fine for us.

    We are not going to be able to put more time into trying to track down the problem. We hope someone who is actually experiencing the test submissions problem will take on trying to find the solution themselves. And, post the solution here.

    [reply][b]In reply to:[/b]

  • 2011-07-19 14:09:16

    Re: i try anonymous first while waiting

    You need to set the start time in the test's properties to some time in the past to have the test appear. It will remain pending until the start time arrives.

  • 2011-07-19 15:09:12

    Re: i try anonymous first while waiting

    Once a question is added to the question bank it then needs to be added to a test. Tests and questions initially are created separately.

    If there is an actual problem, please provide enough information so we can reproduce the problem, including step by step details. You might try reproducing the problem yourself on our demo site. If you can reproduce the problem there, we're more likely to investigate further
